titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the University of Tennessee Postcard Collection, 1903 AR.0765
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Phillip Wadley

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Libraries, Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-11-19T09:54-0500

repository.corpname: University of Tennessee Libraries, Special Collections

did.abstract: This collection contains postcards of print images of the University of Tennessee, a good number of them with messages and stamps. The cards have a copyright date of 1903. While most are postmarked no later than 1920, two are postmarked 1949.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Publishers of these postcards include S.H. Kress & Co., Rafael Tuck & Sons, and Standard News Agency. These are "penny postcards," known to cost only one penny in the early 20th century (however, the price increased to 2 cents) between 1917 and 1919).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Colletions are stored offsite, and a minimum of 24 hours is needed to retrieve these items for use. Researchers interested in consulting any of the collections are advised to contact Special Collections at special@utk.edu.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of Item], University of Tennessee Postcards Collection, AR.0765. University of Tennessee Libraries, Knoxville, Special Collections.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Interested researchers may also wish to consult:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains postcards of print images of the University of Tennessee, a good number of them with messages and stamps. The cards have a copyright date of 1903. While most are postmarked no later than 1920, two are postmarked 1949.
